titleInfo.title: Dr. and Mrs. Isidor Bronfin with Dr. Spivak

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 4 x 5 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#180 JCRS group of pictures''. On back of photograph: ''Dr. and Mrs. I. D. Bronfin in left of photo; Dr. Spivak in center with hat in hand JCRS Dr. Bronfin L. Rear #180''.

mods.abstract: Dr. Isidor Bronfin and his wife with Dr. Charles Spivak and a group of unidentified people. Dr. Bronfin and his wife are on the left and Dr. Spivak is holding his hat near the center of the photograph. Mr. Spivak was a founder of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). Dr. Isidor Bronfin was a physician and tuberculosis specialist with the JCRS. The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue, just outside of Denver. Dr. Spivak also served as executive secretary from 1904 until his death in 1929.
mods.note: Accession # 1271, Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center as part of the JCRS Records.
